# 1. read in the raw data and wrangle

## read in the wrangled data ##

Load data (30 pids)

```{r}
raw <- read_csv("Exp_1/data/data.csv")
head(raw)
str(raw)
```

Wrangle
```{r}
data_emc <- raw %>%
  select(pid, cond, keypress, rt) %>% 
  rename(subjects = pid, S = cond, R = keypress) %>% 
  mutate(subjects=factor(subjects),
         S=factor(S,
                  levels = c("Novel", "Learned")),
         R=if_else(R == "q", "Learned", "Novel"),
         R=factor(R,
                  levels = c("Novel", "Learned"))) %>% 
  as.data.frame() ## in DMC, post predict need a df and not a tibble. Same for EMC2 I think.
head(data_emc)
str(data_emc)
```
# 2. build model with t0 #

## set the match factor  ##

```{r}
matchfun=function(d)d$S==d$lR
```

```{r}
design_exp1_v1_t0 <- design(data = data_emc,model=LBA,matchfun=matchfun,
                       formula=list(v~0+S:lM,sv~0+lM,B~0+lR,A~1,t0~0+S),
                       constants=c(sv_lMFALSE=log(1)))
```

```{r}
p_vector_t0 <- c("v_SNovel:lMFALSE"=4,"v_SLearned:lMFALSE"=4, "v_SNovel:lMTRUE"=4, "v_SLearned:lMTRUE"=4,
              sv_lMTRUE=log(.5), 
              B_lRNovel=log(2), B_lRLearned=log(2),
              A=log(.5),
              t0_SNovel=log(.3),t0_SLearned=log(.3))

mapped_pars(p_vector_t0, x=design_exp1_v1_t0)
```

## set priors ##

try to copy dmc priors.

I made the t0 and sd priors smaller as they are fixed values and it seemed odd to sample a wide range when they are fixed at .5 and .3, respectively.

```{r}
mu_mean_t0=c("v_SNovel:lMFALSE"=0,"v_SLearned:lMFALSE"=0, "v_SNovel:lMTRUE"=1, "v_SLearned:lMTRUE"=1,
          sv_lMTRUE=log(.5), 
          B_lRNovel=log(1), B_lRLearned=log(1),
          A=log(.5),
          t0_SNovel=log(.3),t0_SLearned=log(.3))

mu_sd_t0=c("v_SNovel:lMFALSE"=2,"v_SLearned:lMFALSE"=2, "v_SNove:lMTRUE"=2, "v_SLearned:lMTRUE"=2,
          sv_lMTRUE=.5, 
          B_lRNovel=.5, B_lRLearned=.5,
          A=.3,
          t0_SNovel=log(.3),t0_SLearned=log(.3))

prior_exp1_v1_t0 <- prior(design_exp1_v1_t0, type ='standard',mu_mean=mu_mean_t0,mu_sd=mu_sd_t0)

plot(x = prior_exp1_v1_t0)
```            

## fit the model ##

Note that I changed iter and step_size to make the model fit better and sample quicker.

```{r}
LBA_exp1_v1_t0 <- make_emc(data_emc,design_exp1_v1_t0,type="standard",  prior=prior_exp1_v1_t0)
LBA_exp1_v1_t0 <- fit(LBA_exp1_v1_t0, cores_per_chain = 3, cores_for_chains = 2, fileName="Exp_1/models/tmp.RData",
                     iter = 10000, step_size = 100)
save(LBA_exp1_v1_t0,file="Exp_1/models/LBA_exp1_v1_t0.RData") 
load("Exp_1/models/LBA_exp1_v1_t0.RData")
```

# 3. check the model #

convergence 
efficiency?

```{r}
check(LBA_exp1_v1_t0)
get_pars(LBA_exp1_v1_t0, map = TRUE)
```

plot pars

```{r}
plot_pars(LBA_exp1_v1_t0,selection="mu",layout=c(2,5))
```

# 4. calculate and plot posterior predictions #

```{r}
pp_LBA_exp1_v1_t0 <- predict(LBA_exp1_v1_t0, n_cores = 10)
save(pp_LBA_exp1_v1_t0,file="Exp_1/models/pp_LBA_exp1_v1_t0.RData")
plot_fit(data_emc, pp_LBA_exp1_v1_t0, factors = c("S"),layout=c(2,3))
```
